comment: The professor is amazing! He's very knowledgeable about SolidWorks and wants everyone to do well. He goes a bit fast and is sometimes hard to follow, so don't be afraid to ask questions. He's very open to questions and will immediately help you out if you need it. He skips the drawing on paper and gave us a lot of a tips and tricks on using CAD.
Professor Cole is fantastic. He can help you step by step how to work the CAD system.
Jumped right into Solidworks, skipped the paper bs. Grade is on classwork and a few quizzes. He's incredibly knowledgeable in 3D modeling and is very helpful.
He is alright. took him for hybrid and he uploaded videos of him doing the parts. You can literally just follow what he does. Pretty easy class, if I actually tried I could have easily gotten an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: This is my second time taking this professor, he works through examples and gives feedback where feedback is due. Overall this professor makes you faster and more efficient at designing, as well as helps you with troubleshooting or finding errors within the program itself. Has many years in the field, and vast amount of real world application.

If you want to learn Solidworks well, take this guy. He teaches you alot of stuff and extra useful things, he doesnt spend alot of time on hand sketches and focuses on solid works. Take this guy if you can

Very straight forward with what he wants in class he goes over drawings in great detail, but he does move fast so be sure to keep up. Always willing to answer your questions if youre stuck. His class is kind of disorganized. Assignments, quizzes, & tests were easy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Follow what he does on the board, turn it in, and pass.. Quizzes and final exam was a breeze.

Professor Cole is a nice guy. As long as you complete the assignments, which were pretty much the same throughout the entire semester, you'll be fine. He did use the textbook to assign problems, but it isn't necessary that you buy it since he'll let you take pictures of his.

Ive had my fair share of disappointing teachers and this guy is a sight for sore eyes. His class is very simple. Do your classwork and you wont have hw. No need to buy the art kit or whatever the hell that was. no need for the book just take pictures. He is from Georgia Tech and part time works for KSU.
